name: Pig and Khao - UWS
address: 433 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

reviews.text: Incredible food, Matthew was great üëç‚Ä¶

It was our first time dining at this establishment, and we couldn‚Äôt have been more impressed. From the moment we were seated, our server, Matthew, truly elevated the entire experience. His attentiveness, friendliness, and genuine enthusiasm made us feel welcomed and well taken care of throughout our visit.
We decided to try a variety of dishes, and each one exceeded our expectations ‚Äî everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The food alone would have been enough to bring us back, but the outstanding service made the evening even more memorable.
We‚Äôre already looking forward to returning soon to explore more of the menu and relive such an exceptional dining experience.
& Tacos!
Flavors were amazing. Great service. Highly recommend
The food was awesome, very flavorful, hot and exciting flavors. Josie was very attentive, helpful and kind.

Everything was absolutely delicious, the pork crackling tacos were a stand out. The shrimp was also great. Highly recommend a seat at the counter to see all the dishes and chefs at work. Don't miss the cocktails either! We ordered so much that there was plenty to have the following day.
Amazing food and service! Victor and Mamie  really made our evening special. Would absolutely recommend!
Awesome food, staff and atmosphere.  Victor treated us very well. Highly recommend
Everything was great!  Loved the Fish, Khao soi and Brussels sprouts!  Victor, our server was terrific!

Loved everything. Delicious! Hiananese duck With crisp Rice!
Our server, Victor, was a pleasure!
Victor is one of the friendliest, accommodating waitstaff I‚Äôve met anywhere, here in the city or elsewhere in the world!

Love this place. The food is outstanding. We‚Äôve gone regularly since it opened and it never disappoints. The staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. This is our neighborhood go to restaurant. Maddie and Vincent have both given us the utmost care when we visit
Had a great time. Super delish. So much food we had to take it to go.

What a great experience!  This place is BUSY and for good reason.  The food was absolutely fantastic.  Everything we ordered was soooooo delicious but the tacos are a must-have.  Besides the food, the service was top notch.  Matthew and‚Ä¶

We are spoiled to have this on the UWS! Amazing food, amazing atmosphere! Could not have had a better time enjoying the delicious food and being treated with the utmost care and hospitality by Mike and Matt. Like, just incredible service! The food was divine. Had the papaya slaw dish after we ordered our main meals bc we saw so many of that dish passing by. So good! Tacos: perfect. And the curry chicken noodles dish (can‚Äôt remember the name, but know the ingredients) was beyond delicious. Plus, Lucky Buddha beer to wash it down. Just an incredible experience. Will return as soon as we‚Äôre hungry again! Kudos to this place!
The food was pretty good
So delicious, and immaculate vibes

Eat dinner here. Just do it. It‚Äôs amazing. Matthew and Michael are fantastic and the food is all delicious no matter what you order. One of the few places in the city that 90% of me wants to keep to myself lol

Absolutely amazing food! Great recommendations from our server Matthew. Everything was delicious, but the pork noodles especially were to die for! Wait staff was so good, kind, and fun. We can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Matthew is an amazing, super chill server. Thank you so much! As always, the food is a delicious flavor explosion. Pig and Khao is fabulous!!
Wonderful meal‚Ä¶as a vegetarian this place had a nice offering for me!

first time here for my birthday bc i love thai - I had matthew as my server and wow. I am not even a huge foodie but every dish did not disappoint at all, each bite made me decide that this is my fav nyc restaurant. The service from Matthew was amazing, the food was amazing, I def will take everyone I know here
Food was phenomenal and so was the friendly service from Mamie, Jay and Victor!
amazing service by josie! loved the food and drinks. 10/10 especially since it‚Äôs also a kid friendly place!
Jacquedda, our server, was lovely.
It was an explosion of flavor at every turn! Josie was amazing and we loved the chefs bar seats !5 ‚≠êÔ∏è
Josie was a server. What a delight! I think I'll always come back here.

Super  friendly staff mamie was super knowledgeable she knows what you need her food recommendations was on point the dessert was out of this world literally tears of joy matt and Mike were great as well

literally had the best time here today! just had fantastic service with matt and mike, ray sat us quickly and our drinks were amazing!! Mamie was so sweet too‚Äî great chats!! 10/10 and will be back!!

I recently met the Leah and her team at a private dinner and was blown away by the array of amazing dishes, her expertise and the unique flavors of each course. I took friends to her restaurant on the Upper West Side and was further‚Ä¶
Amazing. Josie was the best. Will be back soon!!!

OMG! Amazing. Food, drinks, people, vibe. Loved our servers and chefs  (try to sit at the chef's counter if possible) especially Chef Kenny, Servers Matthew and Jacquedda. My personal favorites were the pork belly appetizer and the duck and the out of my head cocktail with Pisco. Husband love the moo ping plate and the Khao Soi. Go!!
Matthew was an exceptional waiter. Great service and recommendations. Super attentive and great personality. The food is also amazing!!! Ask for Matthew or the twins!
Food 10/10, atmosphere 10/10, customer service 100/10. The TWINS, holding the place DOWWNNNN!!! Need a place to go THIS IS IT!
food and service was 10/10 ! thank you to matthew our server highly recommended

Fantastic meal, excellent service. Matthew, our server, and his twin brother were superb and made the experience even better! (Matt is cuter). I definitely recommend checking out this restaurant, 10/10!

Amazing restaurant and a must visit in NYC. The food is superb. The cocktails and vibes wonderful. And our server Mike was an absolute legend - great guy and consummate New York gentleman!  Don‚Äôt miss this place.
Matthew was great and so was the food

Matthew and the rest of the crew at this gem of a restaurant really took care of us.  Food really really great.  Ambiance really cool and with amazing people taking care of you makes for a perfect experience.
The Pork Belly Adobo tastes heavenly! Each component is so well done and elegant. My new fav spot in the city!
Delicious and flavorful. Great service Jay was great. Such unique colorful rich combinations. The food came out so quickly. Great atmosphere, will definitely visit again.
Matt was great. Very good service + good food + good vibes.
Foods incredible, fried shrimp is my fave. Jay was the best, service is great!!

Pig & Khao absolutely delivered a top-notch dining experience. Every dish we tried was superb ‚Äî from the pork belly adobo that melted in your mouth, to the tocino wings that hit the perfect balance of sweet and savory. The sizzling sisig came out bubbling and packed with flavor, and the crab fried rice tied it all together beautifully.

The cocktails were just as impressive ‚Äî creative, tasty, and full of character. You can tell there‚Äôs real thought put into every mix. Between the bold flavors, vibrant atmosphere, and attentive service, Pig & Khao is easily one of the best dining spots in the city. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and explore more of the menu!

From the BX to the Upper Westside; this trip was 100% worth it!
The hospitality, ambience, food.. flavors on top of flavors of food‚Ä¶ yum yum yum!! üòã we did the chef‚Äôs family meal and everything we ordered was amazing!! ü§© We will be back!‚Ä¶
Excellent dinner and great service . Matthew our server was very pleasant and took great care of us

1. Love our server (Matt) - so gracious and helpful and all about us having a great time.
2. Love the food - roti/rips/dips is amazing, cabbage phenomenal, papas plate‚Ä¶

Our server/vibe coordinate Matthew was the best! We stopped in on a whim and wow were we taken on an extraordinary culinary journey. We had a great meal - the vibe AND food were incredible. The daily special was a knockout pork belly work of art. This is downtown vibes on the UWS and it‚Äôs greatly appreciated!

Amazing food! We had the family meal for 2 and it was an incredible amount of delicious food. The service was incredible! Matthew made us laugh and helped us pick the best dishes. Jade was attentive and made sure we had clean plates for each new course. We will definitely be back soon!

Jay & Matthew they were amazing and sweet.

Food was excellent
Jay and Matthew were exceptional! The food was amazing! One hundred percent recommend!

The food was immaculate and we had an amazing time. Thank you our server, Josie A! She was very accommodating, warm, fun and we had the best time thanks to her. The family meal was the best choice, we were able to try as much as we could. Highly recommend!!!

We had wonderful service and food! Me and my mom had a great time here where we shared the 2 people special where we had 2 small plates, 1 meat/fish dish and 1 noodle/rice dish. We really enjoyed the desserts and adobo!

Ping & Khao is an absolute gem in New York! The mix of Southeast Asian and Filipino flavors is just wow ‚Äî bold, balanced, and unforgettable. Every dish felt crafted with love, but the khao soi and pork belly adobo totally stole the show.

And let‚Äôs talk about the service ‚Äî Mateo was outstanding! Super friendly, knowledgeable, and had that perfect New York vibe ‚Äî attentive without being over the top. His recommendations were spot-on and made the whole experience even better.

The place has a great energy ‚Äî lively, warm, and full of flavor (literally). It‚Äôs the kind of spot you go once and immediately start planning your next visit.

If you‚Äôre in NYC and want amazing food, great vibes, and top-tier service, Ping & Khao is the move. Ask for Mateo ‚Äî you‚Äôll thank me later. üí•

The only SE Asian spot left in the neighborhood, for now. This saddens me.

It‚Äôs not your grandmas food but it hits just enough of the taste you remember from family gatherings, albeit in a more water downed version. That said, every dish is good.

Service is professional and casually cool, in a downtown kind of way. IYKYK.

The family meal option for bigger groups is a good deal.

Don‚Äôt miss out on HH, Brad. You‚Äôre welcome.

As long time Top Chef fans, we made it a point to visit the original Pig and Khao location shortly after it opened 13 years ago. Back then, it was ahead of the curve, mixing authentic filipino and Southeast Asian flavors with contemporary‚Ä¶

Pig and Khao is a Southeast Asian-inspired restaurant with bold flavors and a laid-back vibe ‚Äî a great spot to unwind after work. I came in without a reservation and had no problem getting a seat at the bar (on Wednesday around 6:30 PM).

Ordered the sinigang fried shrimp, which came with crispy fried okra ‚Äî super flavorful and delicious, with a nice tang and a kick of heat.

We also shared the pancit. It was different from the traditional version ‚Äî mostly noodles, and I really wished there were more vegetables (at least more bean sprouts maybe). It felt a bit one-note in flavor, though the shrimp in it had a great grilled taste that stood out.

The bartender was kind, attentive, and genuinely funny ‚Äî made the solo bar experience feel warm and welcoming.

Overall, a fun, casual spot with character and some standout dishes.

We absolutely loved this restaurant! We ended up doing the family meal and it was a great way to try as much as we can. The flavors were incredible. We also had a great experience thanks to our server Jacquedda. Definitely recommend!

Found our way here by chance after a show and I was blown away. The food and drinks were fantastic but what really struck me was the staff and hospitality. Every single person was friendly and professional and knew their stuff without being stuck up. We left so happy!

Jeisson at the bar was amazing! Gave us great recommendations which only enhanced an already delicious meal. The adobo pork belly was cooked to perfection and the spare ribs and the sauce were the stuff of dreams. Will definitely return:)

Dinner was phenomenal - so many great flavors and a huge amount of food. Hard to choose a favorite dish, but the crab fried rice and the spare ribs really stood out. Our server Mamie was one of the best in the city. It was a great evening.
Very creative and delicious cocktails and food is amazing! Our server Jay was very attentive and energetic. Food was ready impressively fast. I'm definitely coming back soon!

Perfect Date Night <3 I went with my bf and the food was amazing and the service was great!! We got the sizzing sisig, pork belly, tocino wings, and fried shrimp soo fire!! Budha Beers also hit and got the best service from Mamie and Mike! Thanks guys

We stopped by for dinner and loved this neighborhood gem. The noodles were amazing and the Thai milk tea dessert was delicious. We were helped by Trey and Matt and they were both extremely friendly and helpful. We sat outside with our dog and they also took care of the little one :)

Had the absolute best time at Pig and Khao. It‚Äôs been on my list for a while and every time we pass we have thought about stopping in but finally did. The food was amazing and our service was so excellent. Jacquedda took the best care of us‚Ä¶

We are delighted that Pig and Khao created this  comfy and cool culinary outpost on the Upper West Side. We love the papaya salad and their tasty take on Tacos Pastor. Staff, particularly Matt, super attentive but never obtrusive.  Family meal a good deal. Tonight the Massaman ribeye and fried Whole Porgy in ginger garlic sauce superb!
Incredible service, our server Josie was so attentive! Amazing food. Highly recommend the Chili Pan Mee and Sisig!

We had a family-style meal here with coworkers, and it was an absolute hit. Everyone raved about both the food and the hospitality ‚Äî Mike took incredible care of us and made the evening feel relaxed, welcoming, and fun.

The dishes were outstanding across the board, especially the sisig (perfectly crispy and flavorful) and lechon adobo, which might just be one of the best things I‚Äôve had in NYC. Every plate felt thoughtful and packed with bold, balanced flavors that capture the heart of Filipino comfort food.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place that delivers both amazing food and genuine hospitality, Pig & Khao nails it. Highly recommend for groups or anyone who loves sharing a truly delicious meal.

What a great spot for a modern take on Asian food! (Filipino, Thai) fusion!!
Thank you Mamie, Mike for the great service!! And the bartenders for their phenomenal drinks!!!

Definitely coming back!!
Had a great brunch experience here. The service was friendly and attentive, and I adored the ube crossiant, spam egg and cheese roti, and Khao soi! Can‚Äôt wait to be back.

Really nice experience and tasty food. The Khao Soi was unique and a little different from the traditional version from Thailand but still very good. The Massaman Ribeye was one of the best bites of food I've had in a long time though.

The restaurant is a little pricey but the food is probably worth it and the wait staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. Will likely return again soon!

Great experience from beginning to end.
Immaculate customer service and amazing Chef . Food was so good , would recommend this place thousand times .

Disappointed. I had high expectations but unfortunately this place failed in terms of food quality and service. The sisig was VERY salty as if it was just drenched in soy sauce. The khao soi took forever to be served. And the kalabasa sa‚Ä¶

The staff that was working 7/27 around 5:30p was beyond amazing and my rating for them is 10/10 service! They were incredibly helpful, kind and honest. I did have something not to my liking and they handled the situation so so well! I‚Äôll be back simply for the level of service they provided and they were an entire vibe
Great food and service! Definitely go back againüòç Already recommended to a few friends, great choice for friends reunion!‚Ä¶

Excellent South East Asian fusion combing some heavy hitter dishes from multiple countries- we had the noodles, murtabak roti (amazing), ribs, and crispy cabbage. All dishes come in a sharing manner so you can be adventurous and try a few!
They have a small outdoor terrace which is perfect for a warm evening and dinner over a cold beer.
Our waiter was enthusiastic about the menu and helped guide us on a couple items.

Would recommend and will be back!

One of the BEST places for good Asian food and incredible service. The whole fish was delicious and not too sweet. Out server Matt was super attentive without needing to be reminded that we were thirsty. The coconut was not sweet and actually better than the Jasmine rice.

An incredibly delicious brunch! Made a reservation for 6 just before noon. The vibes (perfectly curated and served by Trey and Mamiee) are elevated, yet approachable, fun and casual.

The food slaps! Every dish I tried was my favorite.
We did the Family Brunch option and were more than satisfied. Highlights include the Smoked Fish Toast, Sizzling Sisig, and the Ricotta Calamansi Pancakes. Guava, peach & mango flavored mimosa flowed the whole meal.

Great good, great service, great atmosphere. Good for groups and families as there were plenty of both while we dined. Come get a bite, everything was scrumptious!

When I saw this restaurant opened, I was very excited and I‚Äôve finally had a chance to have a meal here. The papaya salad was my favorite, but everything was fantastic! Our server Mike was super attentive and friendly, and helped us navigate the menu. A gem on the UWS!!
Matt, Josie, and the team of Pig & Khao always take care of us! As OG supporters from LES, we truly love this restaurant and will continue to come back!

We LOVE that Pig & Khao is now in Upper West side! The sizzling sisig is a must. Crunchy and savory. The Khao Soi was a new favorite of ours. Our server Jacquedda was a treat and helped us find the best wine to pair with our food. We‚Äôre excited to come back!
Had an amazing experience at pig and khao uptown! Happy they moved locations closer to my neighborhood. jacquedda was our server and she was great! Very attentive and patient!

As a Filipino, my family and I were so excited to try Pig and Khao. However, it disappointed us greatly. We understand it‚Äôs Filipino fusion, but all the flavors simply felt lost in every dish. It didn‚Äôt resonate to us as Filipino fusion at all; felt like it was adapted TOO MUCH to suit Western palettes. The tocino wings tasted nothing of tocino. The adobo needed more soy sauce, though the crispy pork belly was good. The kalabasa sa gata was nothing ordinary, and such a small portion!!!! Khao Soi was alright- wish the broth was creamier. The sisig was the worst one, with the seasoning as mostly soy sauce- very one-dimensional dish. I will say that the best dish they offer would be the coconut rice. It was perfectly cooked, and perfectly coconutty! But that‚Äôs about it. Glad to see good reviews from this place and that other like it, but again, mostly because it‚Äôs been adapted to Western palettes.

Amazing experience- Matthew was the best server and really showed us an amazing time. Loved the LES location but the UWS lived up to the Pig & Khao name. Will be back again thanks to the great food and top-tier service. Five stars all around!

Absolutely LOVE Pig & Khao!! The coconut rice and pork belly adobo are amazing and I should know being Filipino. The service was outstanding especially Matthew - he was an absolute rock star and elevated the dining experience for us. Will be back soon!

Came here for the food, left feeling fat and happy!!! Order a little bit of everything off the menu, a drink or two and our server Jacquedda truly made us feel so welcome and at home! Ask for her! We are definitely coming back

We love Pig and Khao! Never disappoints. This is their newest location - very cozy and street art vibes. Friendly staff and amazing food as always.

We did the $50 pp family meal- comes with 2 appetizers, 1 noodle, 1 entree, unlimited coconut rice, and a dessert or piggyback shots.

We had papaya salad, sizzling sisig, khao soi, and half duck ü¶Ü would totally come back!

Good, not great! Service was poor. It took forever to get service. And sadly, our waitress was uniformed about the menu. The music and vibe were upbeat and fun. The shrimp was delicious but a bit too salty. The red curry had the perfect‚Ä¶

One of the best meals I‚Äôve ever had in my life. The flavors! So balanced, light, fresh, high-quality food and drinks. The Tocino Wings, Adobo, Ribeye, squash, coconut rice, dessert (in the photo), literally everything was incredible. We had‚Ä¶
Jacquedda was awesome!!! Checked in on us the appropriate amount, super friendly and really helpful! Would definitely come back

I've been here a half dozen times to date. The food is always very good to great. The cocktails are inventive and tend to be good to very good. The service is usually acceptable, but I went with a group of five today for my daughter's birthday - and the service was atrocious. Although we ordered together, three individuals received their food, ate, and had their plates cleared while the other two had yet to even receive an appetizer. The waitress never checked in during that time - and we were required to flag someone down to ask about our meal. No apologizes were given. While the main dishes came out in another 10 minutes (i.e. they still needed to be prepared), the appetizer was still not delivered. When we said we no longer wanted it, we were told that it was already being prepared. Again, no apology was given for the inconvenience. Although the reservation was booked for my daughter's birthday, no mention was made of that - even when we told our waitress. When we went to pay, only half the table received a bill - while the other half was left to flag someone down to pay their tab. Again, no apologizes were given. I was very disappointed by the lack of concern for service despite multiple missteps, which makes me reconsider taking guests there.
We had a great experience and thoroughly enjoyed every dish we tried! The shrimp were a highlight for us - definitely recommend! Mike was great :)

Great all around place, no matter the time of day or night. Get the sisig and mix it well! Always hits.

This outpost of the original LES and Penn District locations is continuing to serve great drinks with a variety of food cooked at a high level.

Happy Hours are good to try a few things, but the main menus have quite a bit of options.

We had one guest who was very appreciative to Pig & Khao‚Äôs attention to personal spice preference.

This was my first time here and I am so glad I came. The vibe, the music, the food, the drinks - it is everything you need for a good night. We got the shared family meal dishes and I‚Äôd highly recommend.

And the server Matthew was amazing! So real and made the space feel like home. We will definitely be back!
